description: Students analyze mechanical principles in depth as they affect human motion. Topics include study of muscular and skeletal systems, skill analysis, and motion measurement techniques. Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week. Offered annually. Prerequisites: BIO 143, BIO 243, and junior standing.
name: Biomechanics
notes: Students in KINES 374 must also register for KINES 374 lab.
This course is open only to rising seniors and juniors.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: BIO 143, BIO 243, and junior standing.

notes: Students in KINES 374 must also register for KINES 374 lab.
This course is open only to rising seniors and juniors.
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
